organizations.name: green party leicester south general election

text:
Green Party Leicester South General Election candidate has a swipe at Jon Ashworth on the NHS By danjmartin | Posted: May 03, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Green Leicester South General Election candidate Mags Lewis (R) and Castle ward council candidate Oli Young-Jones Green Party Leicester South General Election candidate has a swipe at Jon Ashwor... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
The Green Party has selected its candidate for the Leicester South seat at the General Election. 
Campaigner Mags Lewis will take on Labour's Jon Ashworth and Lib Dem Harrish Bisnauthsing on June 8. 
Mrs Lewis, from Clarendon Park, Leicester, is a former NHS manager. 
The 45-year-old mother of twin girls retired after being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis and is the party's national spokeswoman on disability. 
General Election 2017: Click HERE for everything you need to know 
She said: "I'm honoured to have been selected as a candidate as I feel passionately the Green Party message of social, environmental and political justice for all is crucial in the current toxic world of Westminster, hell bent on a hard Brexit." 
She said Labour infighting has meant there has been no credible opposition to "horrifying Tory cuts" and makes the case for a "progressive alliance championing the right Brexit deal all the more vital". 
"The NHS is on the brink because of private finance initiative (PFI) mistakes and privatisation championed under Labour and Tory underfunding and we must act. 
" Jon Ashworth wasn't an MP at the time the Labour Government was making these damaging PFI deals but he was advising Gordon Brown so he has to take some responsibility. 
"His position is unassailable with a 17,000 majority but it is crucial to have a Green candidate because things have just been too cozy for Labour in Leicester for too long." 
Mr Ashworth said: "We'll be running a positive issues-based campaign. 
"The truth is, a vote for the Greens is a vote to help Theresa May's Tories." 
The Greens have also picked their candidate to fight the Leicester City Council by-election on June 8. 
Oli Young-Jones, a 22-year-old IT technician from Leicester's West End,is the first name in the hat to fill a seat for the Castle ward vacated by Labour's Lynn Senior.
